DataElement.preferredName: Minor Component Malignant Neoplasm Intratumoral Heterogeneity Tubule Formation Percentage Score Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric percentage and score to describe the tubule formation of a minor component with intratumoral morphologic heterogeneity characteristics.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Minor Element Malignant Neoplasm Intratumoral Heterogeneity Tubule Formation Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Lesser or smaller in amount, extent, or size._An artifact that is one of the individual parts of which a composite entity is made up; especially a part that can be separated from or attached to a system._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004 _Within a tumor._The quality or state of consisting of elements that are not of the same kind or nature._The presence of malignant tubular formations which are thought to represent malignant counterparts of the terminal ductal-lobular units of the breast._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Lesser or smaller in amount, extent, or size.:An artifact that is one of the individual parts of which a composite entity is made up; especially a part that can be separated from or attached to a system.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Lesser or smaller in amount, extent, or size.
An artifact that is one of the individual parts of which a composite entity is made up; especially a part that can be separated from or attached to a system.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Within a tumor.:The quality or state of consisting of elements that are not of the same kind or nature.:The presence of malignant tubular formations which are thought to represent malignant counterparts of the terminal ductal-lobular units of the breast.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The quality or state of consisting of elements that are not of the same kind or nature.
The presence of malignant tubular formations which are thought to represent malignant counterparts of the terminal ductal-lobular units of the breast.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.
